text:
Q: Can't connect to Milvus using Pymilvus inside docker. MilvusException: (code=2, message=Fail connecting to server on localhost:19530. Timeout) A:

Same issue here. Langchain milvus client can't task to docker milvus server.

raise MilvusException(
pymilvus.exceptions.MilvusException: <MilvusException: (code=2, message=Fail connecting to server on 127.0.0.1:19530, illegal connection params or server unavailable)>

Use the Host external ip, eg: change '127.0.0.1' to '10.2.45.10'. THis works for me.

Docker Milvus version: 2.6.4, Langchain 1.1.3, langchain_milvus 2.6.3

# langchain_milvus not work
URI = "http://127.0.0.1:19530"
#  works
URI = "http://10.2.45.10:19530"

Q: Do SQL databases apply WHERE filters before joins? A:

How can I verify the actual execution order

Noway. The conditions from ON and from WHERE are decomposed and mixed in practice. Study Optimizing SELECT Statements.

Q: Android WebView style background-color:transparent ignored on android 2.2 A:

This is an unsolved bug on Android that lacks a generic solution with hardware acceleration for all websites as of 13 December 2025. The open issue with google is https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/36925660.

And making the WebView transparent or invisible is not a fix because it still shows the flicker.

There are a few things you can try that I have tested on working with my open source no implicit personalized recommendation algorithm social media Android app https://github.com/zeitgeist12345/discover.

  1. One solution is to use setLayerType(View.LAYER_TYPE_SOFTWARE, null) but then things like videos will stop playing on mobile. https://github.com/zeitgeist12345/discover/blob/eddd9effced17ef0d3be9b8fd8d2eedee59b4e85/androidApp/app/src/main/java/com/example/discover/ui/screens/DiscoverScreen.kt#L77

  2. Luckily some websites do not show this bug and you can use them with the WebView. https://github.com/zeitgeist12345/discover/blob/main/androidApp/app/src/main/java/com/example/discover/viewmodel/DiscoverViewModel.kt#L73.

  3. You can start the WebView with "about:blank" and then load your website after that. You can later reuse your WebView for next websites https://github.com/zeitgeist12345/discover/blob/4e25a315efee8526d77bf29a61117ae56413731a/androidApp/app/src/main/java/com/example/discover/ui/components/WebViewArea.kt#L55C32-L55C45.

I checked web browsers like Firefox on Android that use an embedded WebView but do not show flicker. I had two learnings.

  1. Recycle the WebView and do not recreate it. This will increase efficiency by a lot.

  2. Start the WebView as transparent background initially using setBackgroundColor(Color.Transparent.toArgb()) https://github.com/zeitgeist12345/discover/blob/eddd9effced17ef0d3be9b8fd8d2eedee59b4e85/androidApp/app/src/main/java/com/example/discover/ui/screens/DiscoverScreen.kt#L78C17-L78C63. Then using the LaunchedEffect(webView, url) callback posted using webView.postVisualStateCallback(257L, visualStateCallback) you can make the WebView background the default color again just once https://github.com/zeitgeist12345/discover/blob/eddd9effced17ef0d3be9b8fd8d2eedee59b4e85/androidApp/app/src/main/java/com/example/discover/ui/components/WebViewArea.kt#L65.

  3. Start the WebView on a webpage that does not show flicker. The "about:blank" page, very simple webpages and very optimal webpages do not show this flicker bug. An example website that do not have the flicker bug apart from "about:blank" is "https://www.byd.com/". In my experiments having a static HTML page with no javascript removes the flicker.

  4. Fixing the dimensions of the WebView and not resizing it knowingly or unknowingly stabilizes the flicker a lot. This is especially required for me since I use a top bar and also a loading bar (for which I have now reserved space).

Q: How to change text color in output from enscript A:

Here is a thread that has the answer.

http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-software-2/use-of-special-escapes-with-enscript-164978/

In short first define escape character as follow: -e~ (tilda is escape character in this case).

enscript -e~ -Bp '-' input.txt | pstopdf -i -o outfile.pdf

If you want to install and use ghostscript version of it (pstopdf discontinued in new Macs):

enscript -e~ -Bp '-' input.txt | ps2pdf - outfile.pdf

Now, make sure that escape is in your input.txt file: ~color{1 0 0}Your text goes here. in your input.txt file.

When you run the command, your text should be colored in red in the output file.

Q: Android Studio access MYSQL with JDBC A:

In your MySQL, create a user for the application, with scope '%', for e.g.

CREATE USER 'androidapp'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'password';

It means, that it can login from anywhere '%', if you use only 'localhost' it can o
